patterns: Can you tell me you name?
responses: I am the chatbot assistant for School of Engineering at Trinity
My name is TrinityBot and I am an AI Chatbot assistant
I am an TrinityBot, AI Chatbot assistant for Trinity Engineering!

patterns: What are your times or hours?
responses: Trinity is Open Mon-Fri 8:00 - 20:00, Sat, 9:00 - 13:00

patterns: Do I have to come back from Exchange Program to complete fifth year at Trinity
responses: Yes, the exchange year for Engineering is only recognised as part of a five year programme. You must commit to completing the 5th year at Trinity College Dublin. Failure to complete the final year at TCD will mean you are ineligible for a (hons) BAI degree

patterns: In what year can I go on exchange?
Which year can I go on exchange program
responses: Engineering and Engineering with Management students can study abroad in the Senior Sophister year only

patterns: Are exchanges available to Senior Freshman or Junior Sophister Students?
Can Senior Freshmen or Junior Sphister Students go on exchange programs
Can Senior Freshmen or Junior Sphister Students go on erasmus programs
responses: No. Senior Freshman students are required to attend Trinity College during their second year as this is when students foundation engineering skills are consolidated and Junior Sophister year is when the core building blocks of your chosen discipline are learnt.

Yes. Students may go abroad for the full academic year or for the second semester only. (It is not possible to go abroad for the first semester only). If you intend to go abroad for the second semester, please check term dates carefully to ensure that term starts after your 4th year Semester 1 exams finish (mid-January).

patterns: Will my year abroad count towards my degree?
responses: Yes, the year you spend abroad will count as an integral part of your Trinity degree. For your BAI mark, 3rd year counts for 20% and 4th year counts for 80%. Your MAI is a separate stand-alone mark.

patterns: How do I apply for an exchange?
